name: MDLMaterialSemantic
desc: Options for the semantic use of a material property’s value in rendering a particular surface appearance; used by the semantic property.

items.name: case baseColor
items.desc: The inherent color of a surface, to be used as a modulator during shading.

items.name: case subsurface
items.desc: The degree to which light scatters under the surface of a material.

items.name: case metallic
items.desc: The degree to which a material appears as a dielectric surface (lower values) or as a metal (higher values).

items.name: case specular
items.desc: The intensity of specular highlights that appear on the material’s surface.

items.name: case specularExponent
items.desc: The exponent to be used in Blinn-Phong approximation of the material’s specular response.

items.name: case specularTint
items.desc: The balance of color for specular highlights, between the light color (lower values) and the material’s base color (at higher values).

items.name: case roughness
items.desc: The degree to which a material appears smooth, affecting both diffuse and specular response.

items.name: case anisotropic
items.desc: The degree to which specular highlights elongate in the direction of the local tangent basis.

items.name: case anisotropicRotation
items.desc: The angle at which anisotropic effects are rotated relative to the local tangent basis.

items.name: case sheen
items.desc: The intensity of highlights that appear only at glancing angles on a material’s surface.

items.name: case sheenTint
items.desc: The balance of color for highlights that appear only at glancing angles, between the light color (lower values) and the material’s base color (at higher values).

items.name: case clearcoat
items.desc: The intensity of a second specular highlight, similar to the gloss that results from a clear coat on an automotive finish.

items.name: case clearcoatGloss
items.desc: The spread of a second specular highlight, similar to the gloss that results from a clear coat on an automotive finish.

items.name: case emission
items.desc: The color emitted as radiance from a material’s surface.

items.name: case bump
items.desc: The degree of perturbation in a material’s surface.

items.name: case opacity
items.desc: The opacity of a material’s surface.

items.name: case interfaceIndexOfRefraction
items.desc: The index of refraction for the medium surrounding a material.

items.name: case materialIndexOfRefraction
items.desc: The index of refraction for a material itself.

items.name: case objectSpaceNormal
items.desc: The variation in the surface normal vectors in a material, relative to model coordinate space.

items.name: case tangentSpaceNormal
items.desc: The variation in the surface normal vectors in a material, relative to surface tangent coordinate space.

items.name: case displacement
items.desc: The displacement of a material’s surface relative to the surface normal.

items.name: case displacementScale
items.desc: The scaling factor for displacement of a material’s surface.

items.name: case ambientOcclusion
items.desc: The attenuation of ambient light due to local geometry variations on a surface.

items.name: case ambientOcclusionScale
items.desc: The scaling factor for ambient occlusion shading.

items.name: case none
items.desc: The material property’s semantic property has not been initialized.

items.name: case userDefined
items.desc: The meaning of the material property’s value is not one of the standard semantic uses recognized by Model I/O.
